name: Folk Horror Theme
description: Ancient rituals, rural isolation, pagan traditions, the terror of the old ways and forgotten knowledge.

writing_rules.message: WARNING: This theme explores the terror of ancient traditions, rural isolation, and forgotten knowledge. The old ways are not dead - they sleep, and they are hungry.

greetings: The {village} sleeps under the {moon_phase} moon, its {cottages} dark and {silent} save for the occasional {sound}.
Something {moves} in the {distance}, too {large|unnatural} to be {animal}, its {form} barely visible in the {moonlight}.
The {elders} gather at the {ritual_site}, their {faces} hidden by {masks} that haven't been used in generations.
demands: The {ritual} must be completed before {time}. The {old_ones} demand their {sacrifice}.
We must {action} before the {omen} appears. It's the only way to {prevent} the {doom}.
The {offering} must be made at {sacred_place}. The {old_gods} are {hungry|angry}.
farewells: The {village} will remember you... if there's anyone left to remember.
When the {ritual} is complete, none will remain who knew your name.
The {old_ones} do not care for your {farewells}. They care only for {sacrifice}.
narrative_fragments: The {villagers} gather at the {ritual_site}, their {faces} hidden by {masks} that haven't been used in generations.
{character} finds a {book|scroll} written in a {language} that hasn't been spoken in centuries, its {pages} filled with {warnings}.
A {sound} echoes through the {location}, the {chanting|drumming} of something that shouldn't be {alive}.
The {standing_stones} {glow} faintly under the {moonlight}, their {shadows} moving independently of their {sources}.

generic_location: The {location} {looms|stands} against the {landscape}, its {feature} worn by {time} and {neglect}.
A {scent} hangs in the air, the unmistakable {smell} of {old_wood} and {something_older}.
The {ground} is {marked} with {symbol}, their meaning lost to all but the {oldest_residents}.
village: The village {sleeps} under a {pale} moon, its {cottages} dark and {silent} except for the occasional {sound}.
Something {moves} in the {distance}, too {large|unnatural} to be {animal}, its {form} barely visible in the {moonlight}.
The {church|standing_stones} {dominates} the skyline, its {shadow} stretching across the {landscape} like a {warning}.
forest: The trees of the {forest} {twist} into {unnatural_shapes}, their {bark} carved with {symbol} that hurt the eyes to look upon.
A {fog|mist} clings to the ground, {behavior} in ways that suggest {intelligence|purpose}.
The {path} through the forest {shifts|changes} when no one is looking, leading travelers to {fate}.

reassurance: It's just the {innocuous_explanation}, my {relation}. The old stories aren't real.
Don't worry about the {disturbing_thing}. It's probably just {rational_explanation}.
The {ritual} is just for show. It doesn't really {action}.
doubt: Did you hear that? Sounded like {sound}, but that can't be right.
This place gives me the {feeling}. Like we shouldn't be here.
I don't like this. The {locals} are hiding something about the {place}.
realization: Oh God... the {ritual} is real. And we're part of it.
I think I understand now. {revelation}. The {old_ones} are still here.
The {symbol} isn't just decoration. It's a {warning|warding}.
denial: This can't be happening. {reality_denial}. The old ways are dead.
There has to be an explanation. {attempted_explanation}.
No, no, no. {repetition} This isn't real.
ritual: {incantation} By the power of the {old_gods}, I call upon thee to {action}!
The {sacrifice} must be made. The {harvest|hunt|year} depends on it.
Beware the {time|place|person}. When the {conditions} are met, the {old_ones} will {action}.

templates: Explore {rural_location} where {ancient_force} lingers, bound by {old_tradition}. {mechanic} reveals the true nature of the curse.
Uncover the secrets of {village} where {phenomenon} defies explanation. {twist} reveals the dark history behind the rituals.
Survive the night in {forest} where {supernatural_entity} hunts according to {ancient_rules}. {gameplay_feature} tests your knowledge of folklore.
Investigate {disturbing_event} in {rural_community} where {revelation} will challenge your understanding of history. {unique_mechanic} forces you to participate in the old ways.
Escape from {cursed_place} before {ritual} is completed. {revelation} will make you question what you thought you knew about tradition.
folk_elements: a standing stone that whispers when the wind blows just right
a harvest festival that happens every seven years, whether the crops are ready or not
a village where everyone shares the same dream on the same night
a path that only appears at midnight and leads to a place that shouldn't exist
a child's game that adults refuse to play, for reasons they won't explain
a well that gives water that tastes different depending on who drinks it
a local legend that starts coming true when outsiders arrive
